question: Which form of B2B market segmentation differentiates customers according to their “transactional worth”?

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: That’s not correct. Needs-based segmentation clusters groups of customers on the basis of what they normally look for in a product.
That’s not correct. Firmographics segments customers based on sets of characteristics such as industry, location, size, legal structure, and performance.
That’s not correct. Behavioral segmentation looks at the behavior of an organization’s customers toward its products or services.
Value-based segmentation (sometimes called tiering or profitability segmentation) groups customers according to the potential value they may bring to a business.

detailedSolution: Value-based segmentation (sometimes called tiering or profitability segmentation) groups customers according to the potential value they may bring to a business.
